name: Low flow velocity
functionStatement: Ensures habitat availability and water quality during low water levels, and indicates non-storm conditions experienced the majority of the time.
descriptionMarkdown: Low flow velocity describes movement through the thalweg during typical low flow; measurable movement supports dissolved oxygen and limits stagnation, while shifts indicate altered baseflow timing.
howToMeasureMarkdown: Measure velocity with float or ADV, estimate via Manning with low-flow discharge, slope, and roughness, or use a simple model. Evaluate baseflow patterns and timing with hydrograph separation or IHA/EflowStats and compare to reference or regional low-flow stats.

levels.label: Strongly Disagree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Widespread stagnation or no visible movement.
Criteria: Negligible low-flow velocity; scum or odor present.

levels.label: Disagree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Very low or near-stagnant velocities in a normally flowing reach.
Criteria: Only slight thalweg movement; debris often stalls in pools or runs.

levels.label: Agree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Slightly reduced velocities with small stagnant pockets.
Criteria: Minor reduction in velocity; movement persists through most of reach.

levels.label: Strongly Agree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Measurable low-flow velocity with steady movement; no stagnation.
Criteria: Velocity near reference for stream type (e.g., ~0.05-0.10 m/s in higher-gradient streams).
